4357 
4358 // =================================================================================================
4359 // The following code has been taken verbatim from Catch2/include/internal/catch_xmlwriter.h/cpp
4360 // This is done so cherry-picking bug fixes is trivial - even the style/formatting is untouched.
4361 // =================================================================================================
4362 
4363 using uchar = unsigned char;
4364 
4365 namespace {
4366 
4367  size_t trailingBytes(unsigned char c) {
4368  if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
4369  return 2;
4370  }
4371  if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
4372  return 3;
4373  }
4374  if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
4375  return 4;
4376  }
4377  DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
4378  }
4379 
4380  uint32_t headerValue(unsigned char c) {
4381  if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
4382  return c & 0x1F;
4383  }
4384  if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
4385  return c & 0x0F;
4386  }
4387  if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
4388  return c & 0x07;
4389  }
4390  DOCTEST_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
4391  }
4392 
4393  void hexEscapeChar(std::ostream& os, unsigned char c) {
4394  std::ios_base::fmtflags f(os.flags());
4395  os << "\\x"
4396  << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
4397  << static_cast<int>(c);
4398  os.flags(f);
4399  }
4400 
4401 } // anonymous namespace
4402 
4403  XmlEncode::XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat )
4404  : m_str( str ),
4405  m_forWhat( forWhat )
4406  {}
4407 
4408  void XmlEncode::encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
4409  // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
4410  // (see: https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
4411 
4412  for( std::size_t idx = 0; idx < m_str.size(); ++ idx ) {
4413  uchar c = m_str[idx];
4414  switch (c) {
4415  case '<': os << "&lt;"; break;
4416  case '&': os << "&amp;"; break;
4417 
4418  case '>':
4419  // See: https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
4420  if (idx > 2 && m_str[idx - 1] == ']' && m_str[idx - 2] == ']')
4421  os << "&gt;";
4422  else
4423  os << c;
4424  break;
4425 
4426  case '\"':
4427  if (m_forWhat == ForAttributes)
4428  os << "&quot;";
4429  else
4430  os << c;
4431  break;
4432 
4433  default:
4434  // Check for control characters and invalid utf-8
4435 
4436  // Escape control characters in standard ascii
4437  // see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
4438  if (c < 0x09 || (c > 0x0D && c < 0x20) || c == 0x7F) {
4439  hexEscapeChar(os, c);
4440  break;
4441  }
4442 
4443  // Plain ASCII: Write it to stream
4444  if (c < 0x7F) {
4445  os << c;
4446  break;
4447  }
4448 
4449  // UTF-8 territory
4450  // Check if the encoding is valid and if it is not, hex escape bytes.
4451  // Important: We do not check the exact decoded values for validity, only the encoding format
4452  // First check that this bytes is a valid lead byte:
4453  // This means that it is not encoded as 1111 1XXX
4454  // Or as 10XX XXXX
4455  if (c < 0xC0 ||
4456  c >= 0xF8) {
4457  hexEscapeChar(os, c);
4458  break;
4459  }
4460 
4461  auto encBytes = trailingBytes(c);
4462  // Are there enough bytes left to avoid accessing out-of-bounds memory?
4463  if (idx + encBytes - 1 >= m_str.size()) {
4464  hexEscapeChar(os, c);
4465  break;
4466  }
4467  // The header is valid, check data
4468  // The next encBytes bytes must together be a valid utf-8
4469  // This means: bitpattern 10XX XXXX and the extracted value is sane (ish)
4470  bool valid = true;
4471  uint32_t value = headerValue(c);
4472  for (std::size_t n = 1; n < encBytes; ++n) {
4473  uchar nc = m_str[idx + n];
4474  valid &= ((nc & 0xC0) == 0x80);
4475  value = (value << 6) | (nc & 0x3F);
4476  }
4477 
4478  if (
4479  // Wrong bit pattern of following bytes
4480  (!valid) ||
4481  // Overlong encodings
4482  (value < 0x80) ||
4483  ( value < 0x800 && encBytes > 2) || // removed "0x80 <= value &&" because redundant
4484  (0x800 < value && value < 0x10000 && encBytes > 3) ||
4485  // Encoded value out of range
4486  (value >= 0x110000)
4487  ) {
4488  hexEscapeChar(os, c);
4489  break;
4490  }
4491 
4492  // If we got here, this is in fact a valid(ish) utf-8 sequence
4493  for (std::size_t n = 0; n < encBytes; ++n) {
4494  os << m_str[idx + n];
4495  }
4496  idx += encBytes - 1;
4497  break;
4498  }
4499  }
4500  }
4501 
4502  std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
4503  xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
4504  return os;
4505  }
4506 
4507  XmlWriter::ScopedElement::ScopedElement( XmlWriter* writer )
4508  : m_writer( writer )
4509  {}
4510 
4511  XmlWriter::ScopedElement::ScopedElement( ScopedElement&& other ) noexcept
4512  : m_writer( other.m_writer ){
4513  other.m_writer = nullptr;
4514  }
4515  XmlWriter::ScopedElement& XmlWriter::ScopedElement::operator=( ScopedElement&& other ) noexcept {
4516  if ( m_writer ) {
4517  m_writer->endElement();
4518  }
4519  m_writer = other.m_writer;
4520  other.m_writer = nullptr;
4521  return *this;
4522  }
4523 
4524 
4525  XmlWriter::ScopedElement::~ScopedElement() {
4526  if( m_writer )
4527  m_writer->endElement();
4528  }
4529 
4530  XmlWriter::ScopedElement& XmlWriter::ScopedElement::writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent ) {
4531  m_writer->writeText( text, indent );
4532  return *this;
4533  }
4534 
4535  XmlWriter::XmlWriter( std::ostream& os ) : m_os( os )
4536  {
4537  writeDeclaration();
4538  }
4539 
4540  XmlWriter::~XmlWriter() {
4541  while( !m_tags.empty() )
4542  endElement();
4543  }
4544 
4545  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::startElement( std::string const& name ) {
4546  ensureTagClosed();
4547  newlineIfNecessary();
4548  m_os << m_indent << '<' << name;
4549  m_tags.push_back( name );
4550  m_indent += " ";
4551  m_tagIsOpen = true;
4552  return *this;
4553  }
4554 
4555  XmlWriter::ScopedElement XmlWriter::scopedElement( std::string const& name ) {
4556  ScopedElement scoped( this );
4557  startElement( name );
4558  return scoped;
4559  }
4560 
4561  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::endElement() {
4562  newlineIfNecessary();
4563  m_indent = m_indent.substr( 0, m_indent.size()-2 );
4564  if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
4565  m_os << "/>";
4566  m_tagIsOpen = false;
4567  }
4568  else {
4569  m_os << m_indent << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">";
4570  }
4571  m_os << std::endl;
4572  m_tags.pop_back();
4573  return *this;
4574  }
4575 
4576  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, std::string const& attribute ) {
4577  if( !name.empty() && !attribute.empty() )
4578  m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
4579  return *this;
4580  }
4581 
4582  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, const char* attribute ) {
4583  if( !name.empty() && attribute && attribute[0] != '\0' )
4584  m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
4585  return *this;
4586  }
4587 
4588  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, bool attribute ) {
4589  m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << ( attribute ? "true" : "false" ) << '"';
4590  return *this;
4591  }
4592 
4593  XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent ) {
4594  if( !text.empty() ){
4595  bool tagWasOpen = m_tagIsOpen;
4596  ensureTagClosed();
4597  if( tagWasOpen && indent )
4598  m_os << m_indent;
4599  m_os << XmlEncode( text );
4600  m_needsNewline = true;
4601  }
4602  return *this;
4603  }
4604 
4605  //XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeComment( std::string const& text ) {
4606  // ensureTagClosed();
4607  // m_os << m_indent << "<!--" << text << "-->";
4608  // m_needsNewline = true;
4609  // return *this;
4610  //}
4611 
4612  //void XmlWriter::writeStylesheetRef( std::string const& url ) {
4613  // m_os << "<?xml-stylesheet type=\"text/xsl\" href=\"" << url << "\"?>\n";
4614  //}
4615 
4616  //XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeBlankLine() {
4617  // ensureTagClosed();
4618  // m_os << '\n';
4619  // return *this;
4620  //}
4621 
4622  void XmlWriter::ensureTagClosed() {
4623  if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
4624  m_os << ">" << std::endl;
4625  m_tagIsOpen = false;
4626  }
4627  }
4628 
4629  void XmlWriter::writeDeclaration() {
4630  m_os << "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n";
4631  }
4632 
4633  void XmlWriter::newlineIfNecessary() {
4634  if( m_needsNewline ) {
4635  m_os << std::endl;
4636  m_needsNewline = false;
4637  }
4638  }
4639 
4640 // =================================================================================================
4641 // End of copy-pasted code from Catch
4642 // =================================================================================================
4643 
4644  // clang-format on
4645 
4646  struct XmlReporter : public IReporter
4647  {
4648  XmlWriter xml;
4649  std::mutex mutex;
4650 
4651  // caching pointers/references to objects of these types - safe to do
4652  const ContextOptions& opt;
4653  const TestCaseData* tc = nullptr;
4654 
4655  XmlReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
4656  : xml(*co.cout)
4657  , opt(co) {}
4658 
4659  void log_contexts() {
4660  int num_contexts = get_num_active_contexts();
4661  if(num_contexts) {
4662  auto contexts = get_active_contexts();
4663  std::stringstream ss;
4664  for(int i = 0; i < num_contexts; ++i) {
4665  contexts[i]->stringify(&ss);
4666  xml.scopedElement("Info").writeText(ss.str());
4667  ss.str("");
4668  }
4669  }
4670  }
4671 
4672  unsigned line(unsigned l) const { return opt.no_line_numbers ? 0 : l; }
4673 
4674  void test_case_start_impl(const TestCaseData& in) {
4675  bool open_ts_tag = false;
4676  if(tc != nullptr) { // we have already opened a test suite
4677  if(std::strcmp(tc->m_test_suite, in.m_test_suite) != 0) {
4678  xml.endElement();
4679  open_ts_tag = true;
4680  }
4681  }
4682  else {
4683  open_ts_tag = true; // first test case ==> first test suite
4684  }
4685 
4686  if(open_ts_tag) {
4687  xml.startElement("TestSuite");
4688  xml.writeAttribute("name", in.m_test_suite);
4689  }
4690 
4691  tc = &in;
4692  xml.startElement("TestCase")
4693  .writeAttribute("name", in.m_name)
4694  .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(in.m_file))
4695  .writeAttribute("line", line(in.m_line))
4696  .writeAttribute("description", in.m_description);
4697 
4698  if(Approx(in.m_timeout) != 0)
4699  xml.writeAttribute("timeout", in.m_timeout);
4700  if(in.m_may_fail)
4701  xml.writeAttribute("may_fail", true);
4702  if(in.m_should_fail)
4703  xml.writeAttribute("should_fail", true);
4704  }
4705 
4706  // =========================================================================================
4707  // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE REPORTER INTERFACE
4708  // =========================================================================================
4709 
4710  void report_query(const QueryData& in) override {
4711  test_run_start();
4712  if(opt.list_reporters) {
4713  for(auto& curr : getListeners())
4714  xml.scopedElement("Listener")
4715  .writeAttribute("priority", curr.first.first)
4716  .writeAttribute("name", curr.first.second);
4717  for(auto& curr : getReporters())
4718  xml.scopedElement("Reporter")
4719  .writeAttribute("priority", curr.first.first)
4720  .writeAttribute("name", curr.first.second);
4721  } else if(opt.count || opt.list_test_cases) {
4722  for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i) {
4723  xml.scopedElement("TestCase").writeAttribute("name", in.data[i]->m_name)
4724  .writeAttribute("testsuite", in.data[i]->m_test_suite)
4725  .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(in.data[i]->m_file))
4726  .writeAttribute("line", line(in.data[i]->m_line));
4727  }
4728  xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsTestCases")
4729  .writeAttribute("unskipped", in.run_stats->numTestCasesPassingFilters);
4730  } else if(opt.list_test_suites) {
4731  for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
4732  xml.scopedElement("TestSuite").writeAttribute("name", in.data[i]->m_test_suite);
4733  xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsTestCases")
4734  .writeAttribute("unskipped", in.run_stats->numTestCasesPassingFilters);
4735  xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsTestSuites")
4736  .writeAttribute("unskipped", in.run_stats->numTestSuitesPassingFilters);
4737  }
4738  xml.endElement();
4739  }
4740 
4741  void test_run_start() override {
4742  // remove .exe extension - mainly to have the same output on UNIX and Windows
4743  std::string binary_name = skipPathFromFilename(opt.binary_name.c_str());
4744 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4745  if(binary_name.rfind(".exe") != std::string::npos)
4746  binary_name = binary_name.substr(0, binary_name.length() - 4);
4747 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
4748 
4749  xml.startElement("doctest").writeAttribute("binary", binary_name);
4750  if(opt.no_version == false)
4751  xml.writeAttribute("version", DOCTEST_VERSION_STR);
4752 
4753  // only the consequential ones (TODO: filters)
4754  xml.scopedElement("Options")
4755  .writeAttribute("order_by", opt.order_by.c_str())
4756  .writeAttribute("rand_seed", opt.rand_seed)
4757  .writeAttribute("first", opt.first)
4758  .writeAttribute("last", opt.last)
4759  .writeAttribute("abort_after", opt.abort_after)
4760  .writeAttribute("subcase_filter_levels", opt.subcase_filter_levels)
4761  .writeAttribute("case_sensitive", opt.case_sensitive)
4762  .writeAttribute("no_throw", opt.no_throw)
4763  .writeAttribute("no_skip", opt.no_skip);
4764  }
4765 
4766  void test_run_end(const TestRunStats& p) override {
4767  if(tc) // the TestSuite tag - only if there has been at least 1 test case
4768  xml.endElement();
4769 
4770  xml.scopedElement("OverallResultsAsserts")
4771  .writeAttribute("successes", p.numAsserts - p.numAssertsFailed)
4772  .writeAttribute("failures", p.numAssertsFailed);
4773 
4774  xml.startElement("OverallResultsTestCases")
4775  .writeAttribute("successes",
4776  p.numTestCasesPassingFilters - p.numTestCasesFailed)
4777  .writeAttribute("failures", p.numTestCasesFailed);
4778  if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false)
4779  xml.writeAttribute("skipped", p.numTestCases - p.numTestCasesPassingFilters);
4780  xml.endElement();
4781 
4782  xml.endElement();
4783  }
4784 
4785  void test_case_start(const TestCaseData& in) override {
4786  test_case_start_impl(in);
4787  xml.ensureTagClosed();
4788  }
4789 
4790  void test_case_reenter(const TestCaseData&) override {}
4791 
4792  void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats& st) override {
4793  xml.startElement("OverallResultsAsserts")
4794  .writeAttribute("successes",
4795  st.numAssertsCurrentTest - st.numAssertsFailedCurrentTest)
4796  .writeAttribute("failures", st.numAssertsFailedCurrentTest);
4797  if(opt.duration)
4798  xml.writeAttribute("duration", st.seconds);
4799  if(tc->m_expected_failures)
4800  xml.writeAttribute("expected_failures", tc->m_expected_failures);
4801  xml.endElement();
4802 
4803  xml.endElement();
4804  }
4805 
4806  void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException& e) override {
4807  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
4808 
4809  xml.scopedElement("Exception")
4810  .writeAttribute("crash", e.is_crash)
4811  .writeText(e.error_string.c_str());
4812  }
4813 
4814  void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature& in) override {
4815  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
4816 
4817  xml.startElement("SubCase")
4818  .writeAttribute("name", in.m_name)
4819  .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(in.m_file))
4820  .writeAttribute("line", line(in.m_line));
4821  xml.ensureTagClosed();
4822  }
4823 
4824  void subcase_end() override { xml.endElement(); }
4825 
4826  void log_assert(const AssertData& rb) override {
4827  if(!rb.m_failed && !opt.success)
4828  return;
4829 
4830  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
4831 
4832  xml.startElement("Expression")
4833  .writeAttribute("success", !rb.m_failed)
4834  .writeAttribute("type", assertString(rb.m_at))
4835  .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(rb.m_file))
4836  .writeAttribute("line", line(rb.m_line));
4837 
4838  xml.scopedElement("Original").writeText(rb.m_expr);
4839 
4840  if(rb.m_threw)
4841  xml.scopedElement("Exception").writeText(rb.m_exception.c_str());
4842 
4843  if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws_as)
4844  xml.scopedElement("ExpectedException").writeText(rb.m_exception_type);
4845  if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws_with)
4846  xml.scopedElement("ExpectedExceptionString").writeText(rb.m_exception_string);
4847  if((rb.m_at & assertType::is_normal) && !rb.m_threw)
4848  xml.scopedElement("Expanded").writeText(rb.m_decomp.c_str());
4849 
4850  log_contexts();
4851 
4852  xml.endElement();
4853  }
4854 
4855  void log_message(const MessageData& mb) override {
4856  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
4857 
4858  xml.startElement("Message")
4859  .writeAttribute("type", failureString(mb.m_severity))
4860  .writeAttribute("filename", skipPathFromFilename(mb.m_file))
4861  .writeAttribute("line", line(mb.m_line));
4862 
4863  xml.scopedElement("Text").writeText(mb.m_string.c_str());
4864 
4865  log_contexts();
4866 
4867  xml.endElement();
4868  }
4869 
4870  void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData& in) override {
4871  if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false) {
4872  test_case_start_impl(in);
4873  xml.writeAttribute("skipped", "true");
4874  xml.endElement();
4875  }
4876  }
4877  };
4878 
4879  DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER("xml", 0, XmlReporter);
4880 
4881  struct Whitespace
4882  {
4883  int nrSpaces;
4884  explicit Whitespace(int nr)
4885  : nrSpaces(nr) {}
4886  };
4887 
4888  std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const Whitespace& ws) {
4889  if(ws.nrSpaces != 0)
4890  out << std::setw(ws.nrSpaces) << ' ';
4891  return out;
4892  }
4893 
4894  struct ConsoleReporter : public IReporter
4895  {
4896  std::ostream& s;
4897  bool hasLoggedCurrentTestStart;
4898  std::vector<SubcaseSignature> subcasesStack;
4899  std::mutex mutex;
4900 
4901  // caching pointers/references to objects of these types - safe to do
4902  const ContextOptions& opt;
4903  const TestCaseData* tc;
4904 
4905  ConsoleReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
4906  : s(*co.cout)
4907  , opt(co) {}
4908 
4909  ConsoleReporter(const ContextOptions& co, std::ostream& ostr)
4910  : s(ostr)
4911  , opt(co) {}
4912 
4913  // =========================================================================================
4914  // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE HELPERS USED BY THE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE INTERFACE
4915  // =========================================================================================
4916 
4917  void separator_to_stream() {
4918  s << Color::Yellow
4919  << "==============================================================================="
4920  "\n";
4921  }
4922 
4923  const char* getSuccessOrFailString(bool success, assertType::Enum at,
4924  const char* success_str) {
4925  if(success)
4926  return success_str;
4927  return failureString(at);
4928  }
4929 
4930  Color::Enum getSuccessOrFailColor(bool success, assertType::Enum at) {
4931  return success ? Color::BrightGreen :
4932  (at & assertType::is_warn) ? Color::Yellow : Color::Red;
4933  }
4934 
4935  void successOrFailColoredStringToStream(bool success, assertType::Enum at,
4936  const char* success_str = "SUCCESS") {
4937  s << getSuccessOrFailColor(success, at)
4938  << getSuccessOrFailString(success, at, success_str) << ": ";
4939  }
4940 
4941  void log_contexts() {
4942  int num_contexts = get_num_active_contexts();
4943  if(num_contexts) {
4944  auto contexts = get_active_contexts();
4945 
4946  s << Color::None << " logged: ";
4947  for(int i = 0; i < num_contexts; ++i) {
4948  s << (i == 0 ? "" : " ");
4949  contexts[i]->stringify(&s);
4950  s << "\n";
4951  }
4952  }
4953 
4954  s << "\n";
4955  }
4956 
4957  void logTestStart() {
4958  if(hasLoggedCurrentTestStart)
4959  return;
4960 
4961  separator_to_stream();
4962  file_line_to_stream(s, tc->m_file, tc->m_line, "\n");
4963  if(tc->m_description)
4964  s << Color::Yellow << "DESCRIPTION: " << Color::None << tc->m_description << "\n";
4965  if(tc->m_test_suite && tc->m_test_suite[0] != '\0')
4966  s << Color::Yellow << "TEST SUITE: " << Color::None << tc->m_test_suite << "\n";
4967  if(strncmp(tc->m_name, " Scenario:", 11) != 0)
4968  s << Color::None << "TEST CASE: ";
4969  s << Color::None << tc->m_name << "\n";
4970 
4971  for(auto& curr : subcasesStack)
4972  if(curr.m_name[0] != '\0')
4973  s << " " << curr.m_name << "\n";
4974 
4975  s << "\n";
4976 
4977  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = true;
4978  }
4979 
4980  void printVersion() {
4981  if(opt.no_version == false)
4982  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "doctest version is \""
4983  << DOCTEST_VERSION_STR << "\"\n";
4984  }
4985 
4986  void printIntro() {
4987  printVersion();
4988  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
4989  << "run with \"--" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "help\" for options\n";
4990  }
4991 
4992  void printHelp() {
4993  int sizePrefixDisplay = static_cast<int>(strlen(DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY));
4994  printVersion();
4995  // clang-format off
4996  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
4997  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
4998  s << "boolean values: \"1/on/yes/true\" or \"0/off/no/false\"\n";
4999  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5000  s << "filter values: \"str1,str2,str3\" (comma separated strings)\n";
5001  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
5002  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5003  s << "filters use wildcards for matching strings\n";
5004  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5005  s << "something passes a filter if any of the strings in a filter matches\n";
5006 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
5007  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
5008  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5009  s << "ALL FLAGS, OPTIONS AND FILTERS ALSO AVAILABLE WITH A \"" DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "\" PREFIX!!!\n";
5010 #endif
5011  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest]\n" << Color::None;
5012  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5013  s << "Query flags - the program quits after them. Available:\n\n";
5014  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "?, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "help, -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "h "
5015  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*0) << "prints this message\n";
5016  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "v, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "version "
5017  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "prints the version\n";
5018  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "c, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "count "
5019  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "prints the number of matching tests\n";
5020  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ltc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "list-test-cases "
5021  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "lists all matching tests by name\n";
5022  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "lts, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "list-test-suites "
5023  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "lists all matching test suites\n";
5024  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "lr, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "list-reporters "
5025  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "lists all registered reporters\n\n";
5026  // ================================================================================== << 79
5027  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None;
5028  s << "The available <int>/<string> options/filters are:\n\n";
5029  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "tc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-case=<filters> "
5030  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters tests by their name\n";
5031  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "tce, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-case-exclude=<filters> "
5032  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT tests by their name\n";
5033  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sf, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "source-file=<filters> "
5034  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters tests by their file\n";
5035  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sfe, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "source-file-exclude=<filters> "
5036  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT tests by their file\n";
5037  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ts, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-suite=<filters> "
5038  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters tests by their test suite\n";
5039  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "tse, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "test-suite-exclude=<filters> "
5040  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT tests by their test suite\n";
5041  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "subcase=<filters> "
5042  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters subcases by their name\n";
5043  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "sce, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "subcase-exclude=<filters> "
5044  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters OUT subcases by their name\n";
5045  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "r, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "reporters=<filters> "
5046  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "reporters to use (console is default)\n";
5047  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "o, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "out=<string> "
5048  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "output filename\n";
5049  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ob, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "order-by=<string> "
5050  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "how the tests should be ordered\n";
5051  s << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*3) << " <string> - by [file/suite/name/rand]\n";
5052  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "rs, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "rand-seed=<int> "
5053  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "seed for random ordering\n";
5054  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "f, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "first=<int> "
5055  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "the first test passing the filters to\n";
5056  s << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*3) << " execute - for range-based execution\n";
5057  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "l, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "last=<int> "
5058  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "the last test passing the filters to\n";
5059  s << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*3) << " execute - for range-based execution\n";
5060  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "aa, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "abort-after=<int> "
5061  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "stop after <int> failed assertions\n";
5062  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "scfl,--" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "subcase-filter-levels=<int> "
5063  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "apply filters for the first <int> levels\n";
5064  s << Color::Cyan << "\n[doctest] " << Color::None;
5065  s << "Bool options - can be used like flags and true is assumed. Available:\n\n";
5066  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "s, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "success=<bool> "
5067  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "include successful assertions in output\n";
5068  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "cs, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "case-sensitive=<bool> "
5069  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "filters being treated as case sensitive\n";
5070  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "e, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "exit=<bool> "
5071  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "exits after the tests finish\n";
5072  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "d, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "duration=<bool> "
5073  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "prints the time duration of each test\n";
5074  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nt, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-throw=<bool> "
5075  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "skips exceptions-related assert checks\n";
5076  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ne, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-exitcode=<bool> "
5077  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "returns (or exits) always with success\n";
5078  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nr, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-run=<bool> "
5079  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "skips all runtime doctest operations\n";
5080  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nv, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-version=<bool> "
5081  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "omit the framework version in the output\n";
5082  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-colors=<bool> "
5083  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "disables colors in output\n";
5084  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "fc, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "force-colors=<bool> "
5085  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "use colors even when not in a tty\n";
5086  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nb, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-breaks=<bool> "
5087  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "disables breakpoints in debuggers\n";
5088  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "ns, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-skip=<bool> "
5089  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "don't skip test cases marked as skip\n";
5090  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "gfl, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "gnu-file-line=<bool> "
5091  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << ":n: vs (n): for line numbers in output\n";
5092  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "npf, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-path-filenames=<bool> "
5093  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "only filenames and no paths in output\n";
5094  s << " -" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "nln, --" DOCTEST_OPTIONS_PREFIX_DISPLAY "no-line-numbers=<bool> "
5095  << Whitespace(sizePrefixDisplay*1) << "0 instead of real line numbers in output\n";
5096  // ================================================================================== << 79
5097  // clang-format on
5098 
5099  s << Color::Cyan << "\n[doctest] " << Color::None;
5100  s << "for more information visit the project documentation\n\n";
5101  }
5102 
5103  void printRegisteredReporters() {
5104  printVersion();
5105  auto printReporters = [this] (const reporterMap& reporters, const char* type) {
5106  if(reporters.size()) {
5107  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "listing all registered " << type << "\n";
5108  for(auto& curr : reporters)
5109  s << "priority: " << std::setw(5) << curr.first.first
5110  << " name: " << curr.first.second << "\n";
5111  }
5112  };
5113  printReporters(getListeners(), "listeners");
5114  printReporters(getReporters(), "reporters");
5115  }
5116 
5117  void list_query_results() {
5118  separator_to_stream();
5119  if(opt.count || opt.list_test_cases) {
5120  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5121  << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5122  << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
5123  } else if(opt.list_test_suites) {
5124  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5125  << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5126  << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
5127  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5128  << "test suites with unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5129  << g_cs->numTestSuitesPassingFilters << "\n";
5130  }
5131  }
5132 
5133  // =========================================================================================
5134  // WHAT FOLLOWS ARE OVERRIDES OF THE VIRTUAL METHODS OF THE REPORTER INTERFACE
5135  // =========================================================================================
5136 
5137  void report_query(const QueryData& in) override {
5138  if(opt.version) {
5139  printVersion();
5140  } else if(opt.help) {
5141  printHelp();
5142  } else if(opt.list_reporters) {
5143  printRegisteredReporters();
5144  } else if(opt.count || opt.list_test_cases) {
5145  if(opt.list_test_cases) {
5146  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5147  << "listing all test case names\n";
5148  separator_to_stream();
5149  }
5150 
5151  for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
5152  s << Color::None << in.data[i]->m_name << "\n";
5153 
5154  separator_to_stream();
5155 
5156  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5157  << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5158  << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
5159 
5160  } else if(opt.list_test_suites) {
5161  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "listing all test suites\n";
5162  separator_to_stream();
5163 
5164  for(unsigned i = 0; i < in.num_data; ++i)
5165  s << Color::None << in.data[i]->m_test_suite << "\n";
5166 
5167  separator_to_stream();
5168 
5169  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5170  << "unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5171  << g_cs->numTestCasesPassingFilters << "\n";
5172  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5173  << "test suites with unskipped test cases passing the current filters: "
5174  << g_cs->numTestSuitesPassingFilters << "\n";
5175  }
5176  }
5177 
5178  void test_run_start() override { printIntro(); }
5179 
5180  void test_run_end(const TestRunStats& p) override {
5181  separator_to_stream();
5182  s << std::dec;
5183 
5184  const bool anythingFailed = p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 || p.numAssertsFailed > 0;
5185  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "test cases: " << std::setw(6)
5186  << p.numTestCasesPassingFilters << " | "
5187  << ((p.numTestCasesPassingFilters == 0 || anythingFailed) ? Color::None :
5188  Color::Green)
5189  << std::setw(6) << p.numTestCasesPassingFilters - p.numTestCasesFailed << " passed"
5190  << Color::None << " | " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None)
5191  << std::setw(6) << p.numTestCasesFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " | ";
5192  if(opt.no_skipped_summary == false) {
5193  const int numSkipped = p.numTestCases - p.numTestCasesPassingFilters;
5194  s << (numSkipped == 0 ? Color::None : Color::Yellow) << std::setw(6) << numSkipped
5195  << " skipped" << Color::None;
5196  }
5197  s << "\n";
5198  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None << "assertions: " << std::setw(6)
5199  << p.numAsserts << " | "
5200  << ((p.numAsserts == 0 || anythingFailed) ? Color::None : Color::Green)
5201  << std::setw(6) << (p.numAsserts - p.numAssertsFailed) << " passed" << Color::None
5202  << " | " << (p.numAssertsFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::None) << std::setw(6)
5203  << p.numAssertsFailed << " failed" << Color::None << " |\n";
5204  s << Color::Cyan << "[doctest] " << Color::None
5205  << "Status: " << (p.numTestCasesFailed > 0 ? Color::Red : Color::Green)
5206  << ((p.numTestCasesFailed > 0) ? "FAILURE!" : "SUCCESS!") << Color::None << std::endl;
5207  }
5208 
5209  void test_case_start(const TestCaseData& in) override {
5210  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
5211  tc = &in;
5212  }
5213 
5214  void test_case_reenter(const TestCaseData&) override {}
5215 
5216  void test_case_end(const CurrentTestCaseStats& st) override {
5217  // log the preamble of the test case only if there is something
5218  // else to print - something other than that an assert has failed
5219  if(opt.duration ||
5220  (st.failure_flags && st.failure_flags != TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure))
5221  logTestStart();
5222 
5223  if(opt.duration)
5224  s << Color::None << std::setprecision(6) << std::fixed << st.seconds
5225  << " s: " << tc->m_name << "\n";
5226 
5227  if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::Timeout)
5228  s << Color::Red << "Test case exceeded time limit of " << std::setprecision(6)
5229  << std::fixed << tc->m_timeout << "!\n";
5230 
5231  if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedButDidnt) {
5232  s << Color::Red << "Should have failed but didn't! Marking it as failed!\n";
5233  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::ShouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
5234  s << Color::Yellow << "Failed as expected so marking it as not failed\n";
5235  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::CouldHaveFailedAndDid) {
5236  s << Color::Yellow << "Allowed to fail so marking it as not failed\n";
5237  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::DidntFailExactlyNumTimes) {
5238  s << Color::Red << "Didn't fail exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
5239  << " times so marking it as failed!\n";
5240  } else if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::FailedExactlyNumTimes) {
5241  s << Color::Yellow << "Failed exactly " << tc->m_expected_failures
5242  << " times as expected so marking it as not failed!\n";
5243  }
5244  if(st.failure_flags & TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts) {
5245  s << Color::Red << "Aborting - too many failed asserts!\n";
5246  }
5247  s << Color::None; // lgtm [cpp/useless-expression]
5248  }
5249 
5250  void test_case_exception(const TestCaseException& e) override {
5251  logTestStart();
5252 
5253  file_line_to_stream(s, tc->m_file, tc->m_line, " ");
5254  successOrFailColoredStringToStream(false, e.is_crash ? assertType::is_require :
5255  assertType::is_check);
5256  s << Color::Red << (e.is_crash ? "test case CRASHED: " : "test case THREW exception: ")
5257  << Color::Cyan << e.error_string << "\n";
5258 
5259  int num_stringified_contexts = get_num_stringified_contexts();
5260  if(num_stringified_contexts) {
5261  auto stringified_contexts = get_stringified_contexts();
5262  s << Color::None << " logged: ";
5263  for(int i = num_stringified_contexts; i > 0; --i) {
5264  s << (i == num_stringified_contexts ? "" : " ")
5265  << stringified_contexts[i - 1] << "\n";
5266  }
5267  }
5268  s << "\n" << Color::None;
5269  }
5270 
5271  void subcase_start(const SubcaseSignature& subc) override {
5272  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
5273  subcasesStack.push_back(subc);
5274  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
5275  }
5276 
5277  void subcase_end() override {
5278  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
5279  subcasesStack.pop_back();
5280  hasLoggedCurrentTestStart = false;
5281  }
5282 
5283  void log_assert(const AssertData& rb) override {
5284  if(!rb.m_failed && !opt.success)
5285  return;
5286 
5287  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
5288 
5289  logTestStart();
5290 
5291  file_line_to_stream(s, rb.m_file, rb.m_line, " ");
5292  successOrFailColoredStringToStream(!rb.m_failed, rb.m_at);
5293  if((rb.m_at & (assertType::is_throws_as | assertType::is_throws_with)) ==
5294  0)
5295  s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << " ) "
5296  << Color::None;
5297 
5298  if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws) {
5299  s << (rb.m_threw ? "threw as expected!" : "did NOT throw at all!") << "\n";
5300  } else if((rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws_as) &&
5301  (rb.m_at & assertType::is_throws_with)) {
5302  s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << ", \""
5303  << rb.m_exception_string << "\", " << rb.m_exception_type << " ) " << Color::None;
5304  if(rb.m_threw) {
5305  if(!rb.m_failed) {
5306  s << "threw as expected!\n";
5307  } else {
5308  s << "threw a DIFFERENT exception! (contents: " << rb.m_exception << ")\n";
5309  }
5310  } else {
5311  s << "did NOT throw at all!\n";
5312  }
5313  } else if(rb.m_at &
5314  assertType::is_throws_as) {
5315  s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << ", "
5316  << rb.m_exception_type << " ) " << Color::None
5317  << (rb.m_threw ? (rb.m_threw_as ? "threw as expected!" :
5318  "threw a DIFFERENT exception: ") :
5319  "did NOT throw at all!")
5320  << Color::Cyan << rb.m_exception << "\n";
5321  } else if(rb.m_at &
5322  assertType::is_throws_with) {
5323  s << Color::Cyan << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_expr << ", \""
5324  << rb.m_exception_string << "\" ) " << Color::None
5325  << (rb.m_threw ? (!rb.m_failed ? "threw as expected!" :
5326  "threw a DIFFERENT exception: ") :
5327  "did NOT throw at all!")
5328  << Color::Cyan << rb.m_exception << "\n";
5329  } else if(rb.m_at & assertType::is_nothrow) {
5330  s << (rb.m_threw ? "THREW exception: " : "didn't throw!") << Color::Cyan
5331  << rb.m_exception << "\n";
5332  } else {
5333  s << (rb.m_threw ? "THREW exception: " :
5334  (!rb.m_failed ? "is correct!\n" : "is NOT correct!\n"));
5335  if(rb.m_threw)
5336  s << rb.m_exception << "\n";
5337  else
5338  s << " values: " << assertString(rb.m_at) << "( " << rb.m_decomp << " )\n";
5339  }
5340 
5341  log_contexts();
5342  }
5343 
5344  void log_message(const MessageData& mb) override {
5345  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mutex);
5346 
5347  logTestStart();
5348 
5349  file_line_to_stream(s, mb.m_file, mb.m_line, " ");
5350  s << getSuccessOrFailColor(false, mb.m_severity)
5351  << getSuccessOrFailString(mb.m_severity & assertType::is_warn, mb.m_severity,
5352  "MESSAGE") << ": ";
5353  s << Color::None << mb.m_string << "\n";
5354  log_contexts();
5355  }
5356 
5357  void test_case_skipped(const TestCaseData&) override {}
5358  };
5359 
5360  DOCTEST_REGISTER_REPORTER("console", 0, ConsoleReporter);
5361 
5362 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
5363  struct DebugOutputWindowReporter : public ConsoleReporter
5364  {
5365  DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL static std::ostringstream oss;
5366 
5367  DebugOutputWindowReporter(const ContextOptions& co)
5368  : ConsoleReporter(co, oss) {}
5369 
5370 #define DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(func, type, arg) \
5371  void func(type arg) override { \
5372  bool with_col = g_no_colors; \
5373  g_no_colors = false; \
5374  ConsoleReporter::func(arg); \
5375  DOCTEST_OUTPUT_DEBUG_STRING(oss.str().c_str()); \
5376  oss.str(""); \
5377  g_no_colors = with_col; \
5378  }
5379 
5380  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_run_start, DOCTEST_EMPTY, DOCTEST_EMPTY)
5381  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_run_end, const TestRunStats&, in)
5382  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_start, const TestCaseData&, in)
5383  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_reenter, const TestCaseData&, in)
5384  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_end, const CurrentTestCaseStats&, in)
5385  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_exception, const TestCaseException&, in)
5386  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(subcase_start, const SubcaseSignature&, in)
5387  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(subcase_end, DOCTEST_EMPTY, DOCTEST_EMPTY)
5388  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(log_assert, const AssertData&, in)
5389  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(log_message, const MessageData&, in)
5390  DOCTEST_DEBUG_OUTPUT_REPORTER_OVERRIDE(test_case_skipped, const TestCaseData&, in)
5391  };
5392 
5393  DOCTEST_THREAD_LOCAL std::ostringstream DebugOutputWindowReporter::oss;
5394 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
5395 
5396  // the implementation of parseOption()
5397  bool parseOptionImpl(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String* value) {
5398  // going from the end to the beginning and stopping on the first occurrence from the end
5399  for(int i = argc; i > 0; --i) {
5400  auto index = i - 1;
5401  auto temp = std::strstr(argv[index], pattern);
5402  if(temp && (value || strlen(temp) == strlen(pattern))) {
5403  // eliminate matches in which the chars before the option are not '-'
5404  bool noBadCharsFound = true;
5405  auto curr = argv[index];
5406  while(curr != temp) {
5407  if(*curr++ != '-') {
5408  noBadCharsFound = false;
5409  break;
5410  }
5411  }
5412  if(noBadCharsFound && argv[index][0] == '-') {
5413  if(value) {
5414  // parsing the value of an option
5415  temp += strlen(pattern);
5416  const unsigned len = strlen(temp);
5417  if(len) {
5418  *value = temp;
5419  return true;
5420  }
5421  } else {
5422  // just a flag - no value
5423  return true;
5424  }
5425  }
5426  }
5427  }
5428  return false;
5429  }
5430 
5431  // parses an option and returns the string after the '=' character
5432  bool parseOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, String* value = nullptr,
5433  const String& defaultVal = String()) {
5434  if(value)
5435  *value = defaultVal;
5436 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
5437  // offset (normally 3 for "dt-") to skip prefix
5438  if(parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern + strlen(DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX), value))
5439  return true;
5440 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_UNPREFIXED_OPTIONS
5441  return parseOptionImpl(argc, argv, pattern, value);
5442  }
5443 
5444  // locates a flag on the command line
5445  bool parseFlag(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern) {
5446  return parseOption(argc, argv, pattern);
5447  }
5448 
5449  // parses a comma separated list of words after a pattern in one of the arguments in argv
5450  bool parseCommaSepArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern,
5451  std::vector<String>& res) {
5452  String filtersString;
5453  if(parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, &filtersString)) {
5454  // tokenize with "," as a separator
5455  // cppcheck-suppress strtokCalled
5456  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
5457  auto pch = std::strtok(filtersString.c_str(), ","); // modifies the string
5458  while(pch != nullptr) {
5459  if(strlen(pch))
5460  res.push_back(pch);
5461  // uses the strtok() internal state to go to the next token
5462  // cppcheck-suppress strtokCalled
5463  pch = std::strtok(nullptr, ",");
5464  }
5465  DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
5466  return true;
5467  }
5468  return false;
5469  }
5470 
5471  enum optionType
5472  {
5473  option_bool,
5474  option_int
5475  };
5476 
5477  // parses an int/bool option from the command line
5478  bool parseIntOption(int argc, const char* const* argv, const char* pattern, optionType type,
5479  int& res) {
5480  String parsedValue;
5481  if(!parseOption(argc, argv, pattern, &parsedValue))
5482  return false;
5483 
5484  if(type == 0) {
5485  // boolean
5486  const char positive[][5] = {"1", "true", "on", "yes"}; // 5 - strlen("true") + 1
5487  const char negative[][6] = {"0", "false", "off", "no"}; // 6 - strlen("false") + 1
5488 
5489  // if the value matches any of the positive/negative possibilities
5490  for(unsigned i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
5491  if(parsedValue.compare(positive[i], true) == 0) {
5492  res = 1;
5493  return true;
5494  }
5495  if(parsedValue.compare(negative[i], true) == 0) {
5496  res = 0;
5497  return true;
5498  }
5499  }
5500  } else {
5501  // integer
5502  // TODO: change this to use std::stoi or something else! currently it uses undefined behavior - assumes '0' on failed parse...
5503  int theInt = std::atoi(parsedValue.c_str()); // NOLINT
5504  if(theInt != 0) {
5505  res = theInt;
5506  return true;
5507  }
5508  }
5509  return false;
5510  }
5511 } // namespace
5512 
5513 Context::Context(int argc, const char* const* argv)
5514  : p(new detail::ContextState) {
5515  parseArgs(argc, argv, true);
5516  if(argc)
5517  p->binary_name = argv[0];
5518 }
5519 
5520 Context::~Context() {
5521  if(g_cs == p)
5522  g_cs = nullptr;
5523  delete p;
5524 }
5525 
5526 void Context::applyCommandLine(int argc, const char* const* argv) {
5527  parseArgs(argc, argv);
5528  if(argc)
5529  p->binary_name = argv[0];
5530 }
5531 
5532 // parses args
5533 void Context::parseArgs(int argc, const char* const* argv, bool withDefaults) {
5534  using namespace detail;
5535 
5536  // clang-format off
5537  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "source-file=", p->filters[0]);
5538  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sf=", p->filters[0]);
5539  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "source-file-exclude=",p->filters[1]);
5540  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sfe=", p->filters[1]);
5541  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-suite=", p->filters[2]);
5542  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "ts=", p->filters[2]);
5543  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-suite-exclude=", p->filters[3]);
5544  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tse=", p->filters[3]);
5545  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-case=", p->filters[4]);
5546  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tc=", p->filters[4]);
5547  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "test-case-exclude=", p->filters[5]);
5548  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "tce=", p->filters[5]);
5549  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "subcase=", p->filters[6]);
5550  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sc=", p->filters[6]);
5551  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "subcase-exclude=", p->filters[7]);
5552  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "sce=", p->filters[7]);
5553  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "reporters=", p->filters[8]);
5554  parseCommaSepArgs(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "r=", p->filters[8]);
5555  // clang-format on
5556 
5557  int intRes = 0;
5558  String strRes;
5559 
5560 #define DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG(name, sname, var, default) \
5561  if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", option_bool, intRes) || \
5562  parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", option_bool, intRes)) \
5563  p->var = !!intRes; \
5564  else if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name) || \
5565  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname)) \
5566  p->var = true; \
5567  else if(withDefaults) \
5568  p->var = default
5569 
5570 #define DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
5571  if(parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", option_int, intRes) || \
5572  parseIntOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", option_int, intRes)) \
5573  p->var = intRes; \
5574  else if(withDefaults) \
5575  p->var = default
5576 
5577 #define DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION(name, sname, var, default) \
5578  if(parseOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX name "=", &strRes, default) || \
5579  parseOption(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX sname "=", &strRes, default) || \
5580  withDefaults) \
5581  p->var = strRes
5582 
5583  // clang-format off
5584  DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION("out", "o", out, "");
5585  DOCTEST_PARSE_STR_OPTION("order-by", "ob", order_by, "file");
5586  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("rand-seed", "rs", rand_seed, 0);
5587 
5588  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("first", "f", first, 0);
5589  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("last", "l", last, UINT_MAX);
5590 
5591  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("abort-after", "aa", abort_after, 0);
5592  DOCTEST_PARSE_INT_OPTION("subcase-filter-levels", "scfl", subcase_filter_levels, INT_MAX);
5593 
5594  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("success", "s", success, false);
5595  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("case-sensitive", "cs", case_sensitive, false);
5596  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("exit", "e", exit, false);
5597  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("duration", "d", duration, false);
5598  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-throw", "nt", no_throw, false);
5599  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-exitcode", "ne", no_exitcode, false);
5600  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-run", "nr", no_run, false);
5601  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-version", "nv", no_version, false);
5602  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-colors", "nc", no_colors, false);
5603  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("force-colors", "fc", force_colors, false);
5604  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-breaks", "nb", no_breaks, false);
5605  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-skip", "ns", no_skip, false);
5606  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("gnu-file-line", "gfl", gnu_file_line, !bool(DOCTEST_MSVC));
5607  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-path-filenames", "npf", no_path_in_filenames, false);
5608  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-line-numbers", "nln", no_line_numbers, false);
5609  DOCTEST_PARSE_AS_BOOL_OR_FLAG("no-skipped-summary", "nss", no_skipped_summary, false);
5610  // clang-format on
5611 
5612  if(withDefaults) {
5613  p->help = false;
5614  p->version = false;
5615  p->count = false;
5616  p->list_test_cases = false;
5617  p->list_test_suites = false;
5618  p->list_reporters = false;
5619  }
5620  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "help") ||
5621  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "h") ||
5622  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "?")) {
5623  p->help = true;
5624  p->exit = true;
5625  }
5626  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "version") ||
5627  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "v")) {
5628  p->version = true;
5629  p->exit = true;
5630  }
5631  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "count") ||
5632  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "c")) {
5633  p->count = true;
5634  p->exit = true;
5635  }
5636  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-test-cases") ||
5637  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "ltc")) {
5638  p->list_test_cases = true;
5639  p->exit = true;
5640  }
5641  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-test-suites") ||
5642  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "lts")) {
5643  p->list_test_suites = true;
5644  p->exit = true;
5645  }
5646  if(parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "list-reporters") ||
5647  parseFlag(argc, argv, DOCTEST_CONFIG_OPTIONS_PREFIX "lr")) {
5648  p->list_reporters = true;
5649  p->exit = true;
5650  }
5651 }
5652 
5653 // allows the user to add procedurally to the filters from the command line
5654 void Context::addFilter(const char* filter, const char* value) { setOption(filter, value); }
5655 
5656 // allows the user to clear all filters from the command line
5657 void Context::clearFilters() {
5658  for(auto& curr : p->filters)
5659  curr.clear();
5660 }
5661 
5662 // allows the user to override procedurally the int/bool options from the command line
5663 void Context::setOption(const char* option, int value) {
5664  setOption(option, toString(value).c_str());
5665 }
5666 
5667 // allows the user to override procedurally the string options from the command line
5668 void Context::setOption(const char* option, const char* value) {
5669  auto argv = String("-") + option + "=" + value;
5670  auto lvalue = argv.c_str();
5671  parseArgs(1, &lvalue);
5672 }
5673 
5674 // users should query this in their main() and exit the program if true
5675 bool Context::shouldExit() { return p->exit; }
5676 
5677 void Context::setAsDefaultForAssertsOutOfTestCases() { g_cs = p; }
5678 
5679 void Context::setAssertHandler(detail::assert_handler ah) { p->ah = ah; }
5680 
5681 // the main function that does all the filtering and test running
5682 int Context::run() {
5683  using namespace detail;
5684 
5685  // save the old context state in case such was setup - for using asserts out of a testing context
5686  auto old_cs = g_cs;
5687  // this is the current contest
5688  g_cs = p;
5689  is_running_in_test = true;
5690 
5691  g_no_colors = p->no_colors;
5692  p->resetRunData();
5693 
5694  // stdout by default
5695  p->cout = &std::cout;
5696  p->cerr = &std::cerr;
5697 
5698  // or to a file if specified
5699  std::fstream fstr;
5700  if(p->out.size()) {
5701  fstr.open(p->out.c_str(), std::fstream::out);
5702  p->cout = &fstr;
5703  }
5704 
5705  auto cleanup_and_return = [&]() {
5706  if(fstr.is_open())
5707  fstr.close();
5708 
5709  // restore context
5710  g_cs = old_cs;
5711  is_running_in_test = false;
5712 
5713  // we have to free the reporters which were allocated when the run started
5714  for(auto& curr : p->reporters_currently_used)
5715  delete curr;
5716  p->reporters_currently_used.clear();
5717 
5718  if(p->numTestCasesFailed && !p->no_exitcode)
5719  return EXIT_FAILURE;
5720  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
5721  };
5722 
5723  // setup default reporter if none is given through the command line
5724  if(p->filters[8].empty())
5725  p->filters[8].push_back("console");
5726 
5727  // check to see if any of the registered reporters has been selected
5728  for(auto& curr : getReporters()) {
5729  if(matchesAny(curr.first.second.c_str(), p->filters[8], false, p->case_sensitive))
5730  p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(curr.second(*g_cs));
5731  }
5732 
5733  // TODO: check if there is nothing in reporters_currently_used
5734 
5735  // prepend all listeners
5736  for(auto& curr : getListeners())
5737  p->reporters_currently_used.insert(p->reporters_currently_used.begin(), curr.second(*g_cs));
5738 
5739 #ifdef DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
5740  if(isDebuggerActive())
5741  p->reporters_currently_used.push_back(new DebugOutputWindowReporter(*g_cs));
5742 #endif // DOCTEST_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
5743 
5744  // handle version, help and no_run
5745  if(p->no_run || p->version || p->help || p->list_reporters) {
5746  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(report_query, QueryData());
5747 
5748  return cleanup_and_return();
5749  }
5750 
5751  std::vector<const TestCase*> testArray;
5752  for(auto& curr : getRegisteredTests())
5753  testArray.push_back(&curr);
5754  p->numTestCases = testArray.size();
5755 
5756  // sort the collected records
5757  if(!testArray.empty()) {
5758  if(p->order_by.compare("file", true) == 0) {
5759  std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), fileOrderComparator);
5760  } else if(p->order_by.compare("suite", true) == 0) {
5761  std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), suiteOrderComparator);
5762  } else if(p->order_by.compare("name", true) == 0) {
5763  std::sort(testArray.begin(), testArray.end(), nameOrderComparator);
5764  } else if(p->order_by.compare("rand", true) == 0) {
5765  std::srand(p->rand_seed);
5766 
5767  // random_shuffle implementation
5768  const auto first = &testArray[0];
5769  for(size_t i = testArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i) {
5770  int idxToSwap = std::rand() % (i + 1); // NOLINT
5771 
5772  const auto temp = first[i];
5773 
5774  first[i] = first[idxToSwap];
5775  first[idxToSwap] = temp;
5776  }
5777  }
5778  }
5779 
5780  std::set<String> testSuitesPassingFilt;
5781 
5782  bool query_mode = p->count || p->list_test_cases || p->list_test_suites;
5783  std::vector<const TestCaseData*> queryResults;
5784 
5785  if(!query_mode)
5786  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_start, DOCTEST_EMPTY);
5787 
5788  // invoke the registered functions if they match the filter criteria (or just count them)
5789  for(auto& curr : testArray) {
5790  const auto& tc = *curr;
5791 
5792  bool skip_me = false;
5793  if(tc.m_skip && !p->no_skip)
5794  skip_me = true;
5795 
5796  if(!matchesAny(tc.m_file, p->filters[0], true, p->case_sensitive))
5797  skip_me = true;
5798  if(matchesAny(tc.m_file, p->filters[1], false, p->case_sensitive))
5799  skip_me = true;
5800  if(!matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[2], true, p->case_sensitive))
5801  skip_me = true;
5802  if(matchesAny(tc.m_test_suite, p->filters[3], false, p->case_sensitive))
5803  skip_me = true;
5804  if(!matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[4], true, p->case_sensitive))
5805  skip_me = true;
5806  if(matchesAny(tc.m_name, p->filters[5], false, p->case_sensitive))
5807  skip_me = true;
5808 
5809  if(!skip_me)
5810  p->numTestCasesPassingFilters++;
5811 
5812  // skip the test if it is not in the execution range
5813  if((p->last < p->numTestCasesPassingFilters && p->first <= p->last) ||
5814  (p->first > p->numTestCasesPassingFilters))
5815  skip_me = true;
5816 
5817  if(skip_me) {
5818  if(!query_mode)
5819  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_skipped, tc);
5820  continue;
5821  }
5822 
5823  // do not execute the test if we are to only count the number of filter passing tests
5824  if(p->count)
5825  continue;
5826 
5827  // print the name of the test and don't execute it
5828  if(p->list_test_cases) {
5829  queryResults.push_back(&tc);
5830  continue;
5831  }
5832 
5833  // print the name of the test suite if not done already and don't execute it
5834  if(p->list_test_suites) {
5835  if((testSuitesPassingFilt.count(tc.m_test_suite) == 0) && tc.m_test_suite[0] != '\0') {
5836  queryResults.push_back(&tc);
5837  testSuitesPassingFilt.insert(tc.m_test_suite);
5838  p->numTestSuitesPassingFilters++;
5839  }
5840  continue;
5841  }
5842 
5843  // execute the test if it passes all the filtering
5844  {
5845  p->currentTest = &tc;
5846 
5847  p->failure_flags = TestCaseFailureReason::None;
5848  p->seconds = 0;
5849 
5850  // reset atomic counters
5851  p->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic = 0;
5852  p->numAssertsCurrentTest_atomic = 0;
5853 
5854  p->subcasesPassed.clear();
5855 
5856  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_start, tc);
5857 
5858  p->timer.start();
5859 
5860  bool run_test = true;
5861 
5862  do {
5863  // reset some of the fields for subcases (except for the set of fully passed ones)
5864  p->should_reenter = false;
5865  p->subcasesCurrentMaxLevel = 0;
5866  p->subcasesStack.clear();
5867 
5868  p->shouldLogCurrentException = true;
5869 
5870  // reset stuff for logging with INFO()
5871  p->stringifiedContexts.clear();
5872 
5873 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5874  try {
5875 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5876  FatalConditionHandler fatalConditionHandler; // Handle signals
5877  // execute the test
5878  tc.m_test();
5879  fatalConditionHandler.reset();
5880 #ifndef DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5881  } catch(const TestFailureException&) {
5882  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::AssertFailure;
5883  } catch(...) {
5884  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_exception,
5885  {translateActiveException(), false});
5886  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::Exception;
5887  }
5888 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5889 
5890  // exit this loop if enough assertions have failed - even if there are more subcases
5891  if(p->abort_after > 0 &&
5892  p->numAssertsFailed + p->numAssertsFailedCurrentTest_atomic >= p->abort_after) {
5893  run_test = false;
5894  p->failure_flags |= TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts;
5895  }
5896 
5897  if(p->should_reenter && run_test)
5898  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_reenter, tc);
5899  if(!p->should_reenter)
5900  run_test = false;
5901  } while(run_test);
5902 
5903  p->finalizeTestCaseData();
5904 
5905  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_case_end, *g_cs);
5906 
5907  p->currentTest = nullptr;
5908 
5909  // stop executing tests if enough assertions have failed
5910  if(p->abort_after > 0 && p->numAssertsFailed >= p->abort_after)
5911  break;
5912  }
5913  }
5914 
5915  if(!query_mode) {
5916  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(test_run_end, *g_cs);
5917  } else {
5918  QueryData qdata;
5919  qdata.run_stats = g_cs;
5920  qdata.data = queryResults.data();
5921  qdata.num_data = unsigned(queryResults.size());
5922  DOCTEST_ITERATE_THROUGH_REPORTERS(report_query, qdata);
5923  }
5924 
5925  // see these issues on the reasoning for this:
5926  // - https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/issues/143#issuecomment-414418903
5927  // - https://github.com/onqtam/doctest/issues/126
5928  auto DOCTEST_FIX_FOR_MACOS_LIBCPP_IOSFWD_STRING_LINK_ERRORS = []() DOCTEST_NOINLINE
5929  { std::cout << std::string(); };
5930  DOCTEST_FIX_FOR_MACOS_LIBCPP_IOSFWD_STRING_LINK_ERRORS();
5931 
5932  return cleanup_and_return();
5933 }
5934 
5935 IReporter::~IReporter() = default;
5936 
5937 int IReporter::get_num_active_contexts() { return detail::g_infoContexts.size(); }
5938 const IContextScope* const* IReporter::get_active_contexts() {
5939  return get_num_active_contexts() ? &detail::g_infoContexts[0] : nullptr;
5940 }
5941 
5942 int IReporter::get_num_stringified_contexts() { return detail::g_cs->stringifiedContexts.size(); }
5943 const String* IReporter::get_stringified_contexts() {
5944  return get_num_stringified_contexts() ? &detail::g_cs->stringifiedContexts[0] : nullptr;
5945 }
5946 
5947 namespace detail {
5948  void registerReporterImpl(const char* name, int priority, reporterCreatorFunc c, bool isReporter) {
5949  if(isReporter)
5950  getReporters().insert(reporterMap::value_type(reporterMap::key_type(priority, name), c));
5951  else
5952  getListeners().insert(reporterMap::value_type(reporterMap::key_type(priority, name), c));
5953  }
5954 } // namespace detail
5955 
5956 } // namespace doctest
5957 
5958 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_DISABLE
5959 
5960 #ifdef DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN
5961 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(4007) // 'function' : must be 'attribute' - see issue #182
5962 int main(int argc, char** argv) { return doctest::Context(argc, argv).run(); }
5963 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
5964 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT_WITH_MAIN
5965 
5966 DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
5967 DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
5968 DOCTEST_GCC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_POP
5969 
5970 #endif // DOCTEST_LIBRARY_IMPLEMENTATION
5971 #endif // DOCTEST_CONFIG_IMPLEMENT
doctest::MessageData::m_severity
assertType::Enum m_severity
Definition: doctest.h:672
doctest::Context::shouldExit
bool shouldExit()
doctest::ContextOptions::first
unsigned first
Definition: doctest.h:702
DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH
#define DOCTEST_CLANG_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH(w)
Definition: doctest.h:106
doctest::TestCaseFailureReason::None
@ None
Definition: doctest.h:1608
doctest::assertType::DT_REQUIRE_EQ
@ DT_REQUIRE_EQ
Definition: doctest.h:594
doctest::assertType::is_false
@ is_false
Definition: doctest.h:550
doctest::String::operator+=
String & operator+=(const String &other)
doctest::detail::toStream
DOCTEST_INTERFACE void toStream(std::ostream *s, int long long unsigned in)
doctest::TestCaseFailureReason::TooManyFailedAsserts
@ TooManyFailedAsserts
Definition: doctest.h:1612
doctest::detail::Result::m_decomp
String m_decomp
Definition: doctest.h:1036
DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS
#define DOCTEST_ASSERT_OUT_OF_TESTS(decomp)
Definition: doctest.h:1340
doctest_detail_test_suite_ns
Definition: doctest.h:1561
doctest::assertType::DT_CHECK_NOTHROW
@ DT_CHECK_NOTHROW
Definition: doctest.h:589
doctest::assertType::is_require
@ is_require
Definition: doctest.h:542
doctest::CurrentTestCaseStats::failure_flags
int failure_flags
Definition: doctest.h:1627
DOCTEST_MSVC_SUPPRESS_WARNING_WITH_PUSH
